titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Xavier University Student Enrollment Book
titlestmt.author: Anne Ryckbost

publicationstmt.publisher: Xavier University Archives and Special Collections

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Anne Ryckbost using the OhioLINK EAD Application in 2017

did.head: Overview of the Collection

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Xavier University Archives and Special Collections

did.abstract: Enrollment book containing course names and lists of the students enrolled in the courses from 1859-1905. Reading lists are also included for some courses.

bioghist.head: History of Xavier University
bioghist.p: Xavier University was founded in 1831 as the Athenaeum. In 1840 the Society of Jesus took control of the school and renamed it St. Xavier College. It was renamed as Xavier University in 1930. During the period of this record book, the college was divided into two courses: classical and commercial. The classical course consisted of a collegiate department and an academic department, which was comparable to high schools at that time.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Enrollment book containing course names and lists of the students enrolled in the courses from 1859-1905. Reading lists are also included for some courses.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: XUA-86 Xavier University Office of the Registrar Records, Xavier University Archives, Xavier University, Cincinnati, Ohio

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to material is by appointment only. Contact University Archives staff for an appointment.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: There are no restrictions on use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, Folder number, Box number, XUA-96 Xavier University Student Enrollment Book, Special Collections and University Archives, Xavier University Library, Cincinnati, Ohio
